definitions: open area in forest or woodland where trees have been removed
process through which financial institutions exchange payment information and settle transactions
action of removing obstructions or making something clean and unobstructed
examples: The deer grazed peacefully in the forest clearing
We set up camp in a small clearing surrounded by pine trees
The check clearing process usually takes three business days
Electronic clearing systems have revolutionized modern banking operations
The clearing of debris took several weeks after the storm
Road clearing operations began immediately after the snowfall

definitions: visible separation between a woman's breasts, especially when emphasized by clothing
tendency of crystalline materials to split along definite planes
series of cell divisions that occur in early embryonic development
examples: The dress revealed considerable cleavage at the neckline
Fashion magazines often debate appropriate cleavage for professional settings
The mineral shows perfect cleavage along three perpendicular planes
Diamond cutters must understand cleavage patterns before making cuts
The fertilized egg undergoes rapid cleavage during early development
Cleavage patterns vary significantly between different animal species

definitions: large heavy knife with broad blade used for chopping meat and bones
examples: The butcher raised the cleaver to split the beef ribs
She kept a meat cleaver in the kitchen for tough cutting jobs

definitions: symbol placed at beginning of musical staff to indicate pitch of written notes
examples: The treble clef indicates higher pitched notes on the staff
Bass clef notation is essential for reading lower register music

definitions: narrow opening or crack in rock face or other surface
vertical indentation in center of chin
examples: The climbers found shelter in a cleft in the mountain face
Water trickled through a small cleft in the rocks
His distinctive cleft chin was inherited from his grandfather
The actor's cleft chin became his trademark feature

definitions: disposition to show mercy especially toward someone who has committed an offense or crime
examples: The governor granted clemency to several non-violent offenders
The judge showed clemency due to the defendant's difficult circumstances

definitions: small seedless orange variety that is easy to peel and typically sweet
examples: She packed clementines in the children's lunch boxes
The market sells fresh clementines during winter months

definitions: body of people ordained for religious service in Christian churches
examples: The clergy gathered for the annual diocesan conference
Members of the clergy provided counseling to grieving families

definitions: male member of clergy especially in Christian churches
examples: The elderly clergyman had served the parish for forty years
A local clergyman performed the wedding ceremony

definitions: member of clergy or religious order in any faith tradition
examples: The cleric led morning prayers at the monastery
Several clerics attended the interfaith dialogue conference

definitions: person employed to keep records or accounts in an office
person who serves customers in store or shop
official who maintains court records and performs administrative duties
examples: The file clerk organized documents in alphabetical order
She worked as a clerk in the accounting department
The store clerk helped customers find the right shoe size
Ask the clerk at the counter about product availability
The court clerk recorded all testimony during the trial
File your documents with the county clerk's office

definitions: period of practical training for medical students or law graduates working under supervision
examples: Her surgical clerkship provided invaluable hands-on experience
Law school graduates often complete judicial clerkships

definitions: phrase or opinion that is overused and betrays lack of original thought
examples: Avoid cliches like 'think outside the box' in your writing
The movie relied heavily on romantic comedy cliches

definitions: short sharp sound like that made by pressing a button
act of pressing computer mouse button to select something
moment when something suddenly becomes clear or people connect well
examples: The door closed with a soft click of the latch
I heard the click of her heels on the marble floor
Double click the icon to open the application
One click adds the item to your shopping cart
Everything clicked when she explained the concept differently
We clicked immediately on our first date

definitions: person or organization using services of professional person or company
computer or program that accesses services made available by server
examples: The lawyer met with her client to discuss the case
Our firm serves clients in the healthcare industry
The email client connects to the mail server to retrieve messages
This thin client relies entirely on server-side processing

definitions: customers or clients collectively especially those who regularly use particular service
examples: The restaurant built a loyal clientele over twenty years
Their clientele consists mainly of young professionals

definitions: steep rock face especially at edge of sea or river
examples: Waves crashed against the base of the cliff
The hiking trail runs along the cliff edge

definitions: dramatic entertainment that ends leaving audience in suspense about what happens next
examples: The season finale ended with an incredible cliffhanger
Each chapter ends with a cliffhanger to keep readers engaged

definitions: average weather conditions in particular region over long period
general attitude or feeling in situation or place
examples: The Mediterranean climate features hot dry summers and mild winters
Climate scientists study long-term temperature and precipitation patterns
The political climate has become increasingly polarized
They're working to improve the climate of trust within the organization

definitions: scientific study of climate including atmospheric conditions over time
examples: She earned her doctorate in climatology from the university
Climatology research helps predict long-term weather patterns

definitions: most intense or exciting point in narrative or sequence of events
moment of most intense pleasure in sexual activity
examples: The story reaches its climax when the hero confronts the villain
The symphony builds to a powerful climax in the final movement
Physical and emotional factors both contribute to reaching climax
The study examined differences in climax experiences

definitions: act of moving upward especially using hands and feet
gradual increase in value or amount
examples: The climb to the summit took six hours
Rock climbing requires strength and technical skill
The steady climb in housing prices concerned economists
Her climb up the corporate ladder was remarkably quick

definitions: person who climbs mountains or rocks as sport or profession
plant that grows upward by attaching to surfaces or supports
examples: The experienced climber led the expedition to base camp
Rock climbers practice at the indoor climbing wall
The ivy climber covered the entire brick wall
Plant climbers near a trellis for vertical garden interest

definitions: sport or activity of ascending mountains rocks or walls using physical effort
examples: Indoor climbing has become increasingly popular in urban areas
She took up climbing as a way to challenge herself physically

definitions: act of settling or deciding something conclusively
position in boxing where opponents hold each other closely
examples: The team needs one more win to clinch the championship
Her testimony helped clinch the prosecution's case
The referee separated the boxers from their clinch
Going into a clinch can be a defensive strategy

definitions: place where outpatient medical treatment or advice is given
session providing instruction or training in particular skill
examples: The community clinic offers free health screenings
She works at a pediatric clinic downtown
The coach held a basketball clinic for young players
Writers can attend a clinic on character development

definitions: healthcare professional qualified in clinical practice of medicine psychiatry or psychology
examples: The clinician evaluated the patient's symptoms carefully
Experienced clinicians supervised the medical students

definitions: hard mass of fused stony residue from burnt coal or wood
very hard brick used in construction
examples: Remove clinkers from the furnace to maintain efficiency
The old stove was clogged with coal clinkers
The building facade features decorative clinker brick patterns
Clinker bricks provide excellent durability for exterior walls

definitions: device for holding things together or attaching to something
short sequence from film or broadcast
container holding cartridges for insertion into firearm
examples: Use a paper clip to hold the documents together
She wore a decorative clip in her hair
The news showed a clip from the president's speech
Video clips can quickly go viral on social media
The soldier loaded a fresh clip into his rifle
The pistol holds fifteen rounds per clip

definitions: flat board with clip at top for holding paper while writing
temporary storage area in computer for cut or copied data
examples: The nurse carried a clipboard with patient charts
Sign the form on the clipboard at reception
Copy the text to the clipboard before pasting
The clipboard stores your most recent copied item

definitions: instrument for cutting or trimming hair nails or hedges
fast sailing ship with tall masts and large sails from 19th century
examples: The barber sharpened his hair clippers before starting
Use nail clippers to maintain proper nail length
The tea clipper raced from China to London
Clipper ships revolutionized maritime trade routes

definitions: piece cut or trimmed from something larger
article or picture cut from newspaper or magazine
examples: Grass clippings make excellent compost material
Sweep up the hair clippings from the floor
She kept newspaper clippings about her daughter's achievements
The scrapbook contained clippings from vintage magazines

definitions: small exclusive group of people who share interests and do not readily allow others to join
examples: The popular students formed an exclusive clique at school
Office cliques can create unhealthy workplace dynamics

definitions: loose outer garment like cape worn over other clothes
something that conceals or disguises true nature
examples: The wizard wore a dark cloak with mysterious symbols
She wrapped her velvet cloak against the cold wind
They operated under a cloak of secrecy
His charm was merely a cloak for his true intentions

definitions: instrument for measuring and showing time
device or display showing speed or distance traveled
examples: The grandfather clock chimed every hour
Set your clock forward for daylight saving time
The runner checked the clock at each mile marker
The car's odometer clock showed 50,000 miles

definitions: act of recording time especially for work attendance or athletic performance
examples: Employees must complete their clocking before starting work
The athlete's clocking in the trial was her personal best

definitions: person who makes or repairs clocks as profession or craft
examples: The clockmaker carefully assembled the intricate gear mechanism
Swiss clockmakers are renowned for their precision craftsmanship

definitions: mechanism of clock or similar device with springs and gears
quality of happening with mechanical regularity and precision
examples: The antique toy operated on intricate clockwork mechanisms
He studied the clockwork to understand its operation
The trains run like clockwork in Switzerland
Their morning routine operated with clockwork precision

definitions: shoe with thick wooden sole traditionally worn in some European countries
obstruction that blocks flow in pipe or drain
examples: Dutch dancers wore traditional wooden clogs
The gardener preferred clogs for working in wet soil
Hair created a clog in the bathroom drain
Call a plumber to clear the clog in the kitchen sink

definitions: covered walk in convent or monastery with wall on one side and colonnade on other
secluded monastic life or any peaceful secluded place
examples: Monks walked in meditation through the abbey cloister
The cloister's arched columns created beautiful shadows
She chose a life in the cloister away from worldly concerns
The library became his cloister for peaceful study

definitions: organism or cell produced asexually from one ancestor with identical genetic makeup
person or thing that appears to be exact copy of another
examples: Scientists created a clone of the sheep using DNA technology
Plant clones maintain the exact characteristics of the parent
The new phone is basically a clone of the iPhone
These startup companies are just clones of successful models

definitions: scientific process of creating genetically identical copy of organism or cell
examples: Therapeutic cloning could help treat genetic diseases
The ethics of human cloning remains highly controversial

definitions: person or thing that brings something to conclusion
relief pitcher who specializes in finishing games in baseball
examples: She's the team's best closer for important sales deals
The presentation needs a strong closer to leave lasting impact
The team's closer has saved thirty games this season
Bring in the closer to protect the one-run lead

definitions: small room or recess used for storing clothes or household items
state of concealment especially regarding personal matters
examples: She organized her closet by color and season
The bedroom has a large walk-in closet
He remained in the closet about his sexuality for years
Many celebrities have closet addictions they hide

definitions: final part or end of activity or period
meeting to finalize and sign property sale documents
concluding section of speech or presentation
examples: Store closing time is nine o'clock on weekdays
The closing ceremony marked the end of the Olympics
The house closing is scheduled for next Friday
Bring certified checks to the closing appointment
Her closing arguments convinced the jury
The speaker's closing remarks summarized key points

definitions: permanent ending or shutting of business facility or service
sense of resolution or conclusion to difficult experience
device or method for fastening or sealing something
examples: The factory closure resulted in hundreds of job losses
School closures were announced due to severe weather
Attending the memorial service brought closure after the tragedy
She sought closure by confronting her past trauma
The bottle has a child-proof closure mechanism
Check that all closures are secure before shipping

definitions: thick mass of coagulated liquid especially blood
foolish or clumsy person in informal British usage
examples: A blood clot in the artery can cause a stroke
The medication helps prevent dangerous clots from forming
Don't be such a clot and pay attention
That clot spilled coffee all over my papers

definitions: woven or felted fabric made from wool cotton or similar fiber
examples: She bought cloth to make curtains for the bedroom
The tablecloth was made from fine linen cloth

definitions: rope or wire stretched between supports for hanging wet clothes to dry
examples: She hung the laundry on the clothesline in the backyard
Strong winds knocked down the neighbor's clothesline

definitions: person or business that makes or sells clothing especially men's clothing
examples: The gentleman's clothier specialized in bespoke suits
Historic clothiers' shops lined the old market street
